member.name: T:C1.Win.C1Sizer.C1Sizer
member.summary: A container control with a powerful grid layout manager that extends the basic layout capabilities provided by the .NET framework (Dock and Anchor properties).

remarks.para: The C1Sizer control allows you to define a grid made up of bands, then add controls that snap to these bands. When the C1Sizer control is resized, the bands are automatically recalculated, and contained controls move automatically to their new positions.
You can set up bands at design time and configure them to act as splitters or to keep their size constant when the control is resized.
You will rarely have to write any code in order to use the C1Sizer component. In most applications, you will follow these steps:
1) Add one or more C1Sizer controls to the form, and set their Dock property to fill the form,
2) Use the Grid Editor to set up a grid layout at design time, and add controls which will snap to the grid.
You can use the Grid Editor to set the number and dimension of the grid's bands (rows and columns), and also to specify which bands should act as splitters, and which should have fixed dimensions.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1Sizer.C1Sizer.Grid
member.summary: Returns a reference to a object that contains the layout information for the control.

remarks.para: The Grid object contains collections of bands ( and objects) that determine how the control adjusts its internal layout when it is resized.
All controls contained in a C1Sizer control are attached to specific bands in the Grid object.

member.name: T:C1.Win.C1Sizer.C1SizerLight
member.summary: Component that resizes all controls on a form when the form is resized.

remarks.para: When you add a component to a form, it keeps track of the forms' size and position. When the form is resized, resizes all contained controls proportionally, so the form retains its appearance at any resolution.
can also resize the fonts on all or some of the contained controls.

You will rarely have to write any code in order to use the component. In most applications, you will simply design forms as usual, then add a component to the form and let it resize all controls on the form automatically, when the form is resized.

In some cases, you may want to control how fonts are resized when the form dimensions change. You can prevent all font resizing by setting the property to false. Or you can keep the font size constant for certain controls by handling the event.
Note that the component does not work at design time. This allows you to resize your form without affecting the layout of the controls on the form.

member.name: E:C1.Win.C1Sizer.C1SizerLight.ResizingFont
member.summary: Fires before the resizes the font in a control in response to the form being resized.

remarks.para: By default, will resize all child controls on a form and will also update their fonts when the form is resized.

In some cases, you may want to prevent the from resizing the font for certain controls on the form. For example, scrollable controls often don't need font resizing. When their dimensions change, the user can still scroll to view their contents.

member.name: E:C1.Win.C1Sizer.C1SizerLight.ResizingControl
member.summary: Fires before the resizes a control in response to the form being resized.

remarks.para: By default, will resize all child controls on a form when the form is resized (except controls that are docked or contained in a C1Sizer control).

In some cases, you may want to prevent the from resizing certain controls on the form. For example, you may have a an event handler that takes care of resizing specific controls on the form using specialized logic.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1Sizer.C1SizerLight.Enabled
member.summary: Determines whether the should resize the controls on the form when the form is resized.

remarks.para: This property has no effect at design time. Child controls are automatically resized at run time only.
If you need to create controls at run time, you should set the Enabled property to false, create the controls, then set it back to true. This will allow to update its internal layout information.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1Sizer.C1SizerLight.ResizeFonts
member.summary: Determines whether the should resize control fonts in addition to the controls themselves.

member.name: M:C1.Win.C1Sizer.BandCollection.SetSizes(System.Int32[])
member.summary: Sets the size of multiple bands in the collection.
member.param: A vector containing the new sizes for each band in the collection.

remarks.para: You can set the size of a object by setting its property. However, this will cause other bands to resize immediately, so the collection always fills the client area of the control.
This method allows you to set the size of multiple bands simultaneously, with a single call.
Any negative dimensions in the sizes array will be ignored, and the corresponding bands will retain their current dimension.

member.name: T:C1.Win.C1Sizer.Band
member.summary: Abstract class that serves as a base for the and classes.

member.name: M:C1.Win.C1Sizer.Band.SetSize(System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Sets the size of the band and optionally adjusts the other bands so the collection fills the control.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1Sizer.Band.IsFixedSize
member.summary: Determines whether the should retain its size when the control is resized.

remarks.para: When the control is resized, it updates the layout grid so it always fills the control's client area. Normally, this is done by scaling every band and keeping their proportion constant.

In some cases, however, you may want to keep the size of a band constant, and let the other bands shrink or expand to accommodate the new control dimensions. For example, you may have a row that contains constant-size headings, and should not be resized with the control. In these cases, set the IsFixedSize property to true and the band will not be resized when the control dimensions change.
The IsFixedSize property prevents the control from resizing the band when the control is resized. It does not prevent the user from resizing the band with the mouse if the property is set to true.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1Sizer.Band.IsSplitter
member.summary: Determines whether the band acts like a splitter (can be resized with the mouse at run time).

remarks.para: The IsSplitter property controls the splitter bar below each row and to the right of each column.
IsSplitter has no effect on the last band in a collection, because the last band always ends at the edge of the control and thus cannot be resized with the mouse.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1Sizer.Band.Index
member.summary: Gets the index of the in the owner collection.

member.summary: Gets a that represents the size and location of the band within the parent control.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1Sizer.Band.Size
member.summary: Gets or sets the size of this object.

remarks.para: If the Band is a object, the size represents the row height in pixels.
If the Band is a object, the size represents the column width in pixels.

member.summary: Represents a row in the Sizer grid.

member.summary: Returns a string representation of the object.
member.returns: A string representation of the object

member.name: M:C1.Win.C1Sizer.Row.SetSize(System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Gets or sets the size of the as a percentage of the grid's height.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1Sizer.Row.Size
member.summary: Gets or sets the height of the in pixels.

remarks.para: The Size property is updated whenever the control is resized, so that the rows take up the entire height of the control.
You can prevent specific rows from being resized with the form by setting their property. You can also set the size of multiple rows with a single call using the method in the class.
When entering row heights or column widths into the PropertyGrid, you may also specify values as percentages of the control size (e.g. "25%").

member.summary: Gets or sets the position of the within the grid.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1Sizer.Column.Size

You can prevent specific columns from being resized with the form by setting their property. You can also set the size of multiple columns with a single call using the method in the class.
When entering row heights or column widths into the PropertyGrid, you may also specify values as percentages of the control size (e.g. "25%").

member.name: F:C1.Win.C1Sizer.ImageScaling.Stretch
member.summary: Stretch the image to fill the display area. This mode will usually change the image's aspect ratio.

member.name: F:C1.Win.C1Sizer.ImageScaling.Scale
member.summary: Scale the image to fit the display area. This mode may increase or reduce the size of the image while maintaining its aspect ratio.

member.name: F:C1.Win.C1Sizer.ImageScaling.Tile
member.summary: Tile the image to fill the display area.

member.name: F:C1.Win.C1Sizer.ImageScaling.TileStretch
member.summary: Tile the image into a 3x3 matrix and stretch it to fill the display area. This mode preserves the size of the four corners of the image.

member.name: F:C1.Win.C1Sizer.ImageScaling.TileStretchHorizontal
member.summary: Tile the image into a row of 3 images and stretch it to fill the display area. This mode preserves the size of the left and right parts of the image.

member.name: F:C1.Win.C1Sizer.ImageScaling.TileStretchVertical
member.summary: Tile the image into a column of 3 images and stretch it to fill the display area. This mode preserves the size of the top and bottom parts of the image.

member.name: F:C1.Win.C1Sizer.ImageScaling.Hide
member.summary: Hide the image.

member.name: T:C1.Win.C1Sizer.GradientMode
member.summary: Specifies the background gradient mode.

member.name: F:C1.Win.C1Sizer.GradientMode.None
member.summary: No gradient.

member.name: F:C1.Win.C1Sizer.GradientMode.Horizontal
member.summary: Horizontal gradient (from BackColor on the left to BackColor2 on the right).

member.name: F:C1.Win.C1Sizer.GradientMode.Vertical
member.summary: Vertical gradient (from BackColor on the top to BackColor2 on the bottom).

member.name: F:C1.Win.C1Sizer.GradientMode.DiagonalDown
member.summary: Diagonal gradient (from BackColor on the left-top to BackColor2 on the right-bottom).

member.name: F:C1.Win.C1Sizer.GradientMode.DiagonalUp
member.summary: Diagonal gradient (from BackColor on the left-bottom to BackColor2 on the right-top).

member.name: F:C1.Win.C1Sizer.GradientMode.Radial
member.summary: Radial gradient (from BackColor on the edges to BackColor2 on the center).

summary.para: The class contains display attributes that determine the appearance of content on the screen/printer. It includes most elements found in Css styles.
The class also contains methods for rendering and measuring content (strings and images) based on the style settings (fonts, margins, etc).

The objects are not hierarchical in the sense that they don't have parent styles and don't inherit attributes from the parent style. To create a new style based on an existing one, you would clone the original style, then apply whatever attributes you want to the new style.
